result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gregory O'Brien Coney

records.addlTxt:
No controlled substances without a valid prescription in defendant's name. 
No drug paraphernalia. 
DEFENDANT MUST COMPLY WITH THE BOND MONITORING PROGRAM FOR "RESTRICTED TO RESIDENCE" PURPOSES ONLY. 
DEFENDANT MUST GO IMMEDIATELY TO THE JUSTICE PROGRAMS OFFICE UPON SIGNING OF BOND AND/OR RELEASE.  
THE BOND MONITORING PROGRAM IS LOCATED IN THE MONROE COUNTY JUSTICE CENTER AT 112 SOUTH COURT STREET, ROOM 1008, SPARTA, WI. 
DEFENDANT MUST BE EQUIPPED WITH A GPS DEVICE THROUGH THE BOND MONITORING PROGRAM. 
***DEFENDANT TO BE RESTRICTED TO RESIDENCE DETERMINED BY JUSTICE DEPT AND IS NOT ALLOWED TO LEAVE THEIR RESIDENCE EXCEPT FOR WORK, TREATMENT, TESTING PURPOSES, OR EXCEPTIONS APPROVED BY BOND MONITORING PROGRAM, AND ONLY IF APPROVED IN ADVANCE.
DEFENDANT NOT REQUIRED TO TEST.

Defendant Gregory O'Brien Coney appeared by phone.  Attorney Elizabeth C. Grabow appeared by video for Gregory O'Brien Coney. Attorney McMahon appears via zoom video. Attorney Betthauser appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. T. Nichols from Justice Department appears via zoom video. Justice Department gives updates stating that Defendant is not compliant with BMP. Attorney states that they have no resolution and needs to be scheduled for Jury Trials. Attorney Long to provide request for Jury Trials to the court (letter due by 11/4/22). Judicial Assistant will scheduled Jury Trials. Court amends bond to remove Bond testing requirement, house arrest remains on bonds (GPS). Rest of conditions remain, if not already on bond BMP 5 added. Status hearing for 10/31/22 removed, addressed today.
